answers.answer: Dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA) is a hormone produced by the adrenal glands and is a precursor to the sex hormones estrogen and testosterone. Blood levels of DHEA peak in the 20's but decline dramatically with age.  DHEA is frequently referred to as an anti aging hormone.  DHEA deficiency is confirmed if levels drop below 180 ng/dL in men and 130 ng/dL in women.DHEA deficiency is associated with increased vulnerability to a variety of cancers (including breast, ovarian, prostate, and bladder), atherosclerosis (hardening of the arteries), high blood pressure, diabetes, nerve degeneration, Parkinson's disease, diabetes, and other age related conditions.DHEA is available in nonprescription pills and capsules.  Also, chromium picolinate supplements are reported to boost the body's DHEA production.

question: What exactly is this test for.  I thought I was being tested for a tatesterone problem. Mine came back <15.0
title: DHEAS blood test
